page.title: 11LEIGHTON FIRE SERVICE
page.content: The local Fire Service covers Leighton Buzzard and surrounding villages but will go further to help other stations if needed. The station is situated in Lake Street and has two pumping appliances and one land rover. There are eight full time fireman and eleven part-timers. A crew of five men to each pumping appliance, and two go in the rover. The firemen wear the standard uniform but have a badge and buttons with the Bedfordshire Crest. The most common types of fire in the area are grass or chimney fires. The largest fire in 1985 was the fire at All Saints Church in Leighton Buzzard. Ten appliances were in attendance and it took four hours to get it under control and fourteen hours to put it out. The church spire was burnt out and 50% of the inside was damaged.
